metadata.title: CVE-2019-11763 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Failure to correctly handle null bytes when processing HTML entitiesresulted in Firefox incorrectly parsing these entities. This could have ledto HTML comment text being treated as HTML which could have led to XSS in aweb application under certain conditions. It could have also led to HTMLentities being masked from filters - enabling the use of entities to maskthe actual characters of interest from filters. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 70, Thunderbird < 68.2, and Firefox ESR < 68.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11763` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '70.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
